title: Cavaliers-Clippers swap stars: Grading both sides of James Harden-Darius Garland trade

title: Sources: Clips deal Harden to Cavs, land Garland
content: In a swap of two star guards, the LA Clippers are trading James Harden to the Cleveland Cavaliers for Darius Garland and a second-round pick, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania on Tuesday.

content: LeBron James is expected to finish out the season with the Lakers, league sources told ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Curry, LeBron, KD to team up at ASG; Kawhi, too
content: Stephen Curry will be joining Olympic teammates LeBron James and Kevin Durant once again, this time at the NBA All-Star Game. And the Clippers' Kawhi Leonard was added to the pool of U.S. players Tuesday shortly before the rosters were unveiled.

title: Sources: Celtics land Vucevic in trade with Bulls

title: Why Governor K.K. Shah recommended dismissal of DMK government in Tamil Nadu during Emergency 50 years ago
content: Not clamping down on anti-Emergency publications too led to the dissolution of Karunanidhi-led DMK government in Tamil Nadu in 1976, when the State was brought under the President‚Äôs rule for the fist time.

title: Air India plane flown afterphysical checks, no abnormal parameters noticed: DGCA
content: The fuel control switch of the left engine of the Dreamliner aircraft VT-ANX, which operated the flight AI132 that had more than 200 people on board, did not latch on the 'RUN' position twice during the engine start at London Heathrow airport, but was properly locked in the 'RUN' position on the third attempt

title: 16th Finance Commission points to regressive free power benefits in Tamil Nadu
content: Power subsidies flow disproportionately to higher consumption households. Over 2.3 crore consumers enjoy free electricity up to 100 units bimonthly, regardless of level of consumption

title: Case against West Bengal SIR: Mamata Banerjee likely to appear in person in Supreme Court on February 4
content: A batch of petitions challenging the constitutionality of the SIR process and the mass exclusion of electors from the voters‚Äô list of the State is listed for hearing on February 4, 2026

content: Lower tariffs to help seafood exporters recover ground, says industry group; SKM says allowing 0% import tariffs on U.S. goods is a surrender to U.S. imperialism that will devastate Indian farmers

title: BIFFes 2026: Women directors call for cinema beyond the male gaze
content: At the Bengaluru International Film Festival, filmmakers Jacqueline Roussety, Sindhu Sreenivasa Murthy and Nidhi Saxena tackled the frustrating double standards in how films portray men and women

title: Drop in KIA‚Äôs domestic passenger numbers in December 2025 due to IndiGo crisis
content: Kempegowda International Airport handled 3,133,697 passengers in December 2025, compared to 3,279,765 passengers in November 2025

title: Tremors felt across Kolkata, adjacent areas as quake hits Myanmar
content: A section of residents in high-rise buildings and office employees said they experienced the aftershocks of the quake, which struck Myanmar at around 9.04 p.m. IST and lasted for a few seconds.

title: A.P. to set up palliative centres in all teaching hospitals in State, says Minister
content: Satya Kumar Yadav says the government is also considering the idea of expanding cancer care services to every district headquarters; notes that the number of cancer cases has seen gradual increase in Andhra Pradesh from 25,487 in 2020 to 35,546 in 2025

content: Chandrababu Naidu directs officials to develop a Cocoa City over 500 acres in Eluru district; announces that registration of aquaculture activities will be made mandatory; suggests organising crop-festivals in various regions to promote awareness of different crops and boost tourism

content: Residence of a businessman and a police officer was searched during the raids with cash seized from the premises

content: Opposition has alleged that there is corruption to the tune of ‚Çπ 6,000 crore in the Excise Department

title: GSI to probe land subsidence in Godavari delta in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Water Resource Department has roped in the experts to fix the scientific reasons for the land subsidence, factors for the defunct 350-long irrigation drains in the Central Delta thriving with oil and natural gas exploration activities.

title: Government signs MoU to establish Bharat Container Shipping Line
content: The Bharat Container Shipping Line will anchor India‚Äôs container trade in Indian hands and strengthen our strategic and commercial presence in global maritime trade, the minister said

content: Kerala State Women‚Äôs Development Corporation‚Äôs Escalera 2026, a women‚Äôs fest, begins at Kanakakkunnu

title: Kerala being punished for not accepting BJP: Pinarayi
content: Congress is acting like BJP‚Äôs B-team and is remaining silent even as the Union govt. is financially choking the State, says Chief Minister

title: UDF finalising candidate list for Kottayam ahead of Statewide rally
content: The UDF aims to finalise candidates, aligning with Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan‚Äôs rally on February 24. Amid ongoing seat-sharing disputes, particularly in Changanassery and Ettumanur, UDF leaders are prioritising candidates with community support to reclaim lost seats.

title: India-U.S. trade deal will not include sensitive agricultural items and dairy: Goyal
content: The Commerce and Industry Minister says the deal would benefit all of India‚Äôs labour-intensive exporting sectors; blames Opposition for not making statement in Parliament; joint India-U.S. note awaited¬†

title: Ex-corporators threaten agitation if e‚ÄëKhata software glitches aren‚Äôt fixed within a week
content: The former mayer points out that technical glitches have repeatedly marred the e-Khata system ever since it was introduced over six months ago

content: The leaders were on their way to the Collectorate to join the protest against alleged irregularities of Mohan Babu University, when nearly 30 persons reportedly attacked SFI district general secretary S. Akbar and the federation‚Äôs SVU students‚Äô union leader Vinod

title: West Bengal BJP admits harassment of voters during SIR; blames poll officials, TMC
content: BJP MLAs submit memo to Governor claiming a section of EROS, AEROs, BLOs are making ‚Äúdeliberate‚Äù mistakes during SIR, issuing notices to harass people, in collusion with Trinamool Congress and I-PAC

title: Don‚Äôt issue work order for ECR elevated corridor, orders Madras High Court
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan pass the interim order on a writ appeal filed by a disqualified bidder

title: ‚ÄòConsent to share‚Äô a sham, like pact between lion and lamb: SC warns WA over personal data
content: Dealing with appeals by WhatsApp, its parent company Meta which also owns Facebook, challenging a NCLAT decision that upheld Competition Commissions finding of abuse of dominant position against the social media giant, a bench of CJI Surya Kant and Justices Joymalya Bagchi and Vipul M Pancholi scorched it with admonitions for violating right to privacy of Indian citizens.

title: Agriculture, dairy shielded in India-US deal; trade pact in weeks
content: As a result, cereals, maize, soybean and genetically modified food may be kept out of the bilateral trade agreement, which has been in the works since last Feb. Goyal said that Modi had managed to secure a very good deal for India, which was better than what US had offered to some other competing countries. Indian and American officials are currently engaged in drafting a joint statement which is expected to be finalised in the next few days.

title: World recognising India‚Äôs strength: PM Modi to NDA MPs
content: Addressing the BJP-led NDA parliamentary party meeting where he was felicitated for India‚Äôs trade agreements, including with EU and US, Modi said India is at the centre of an uncertain world as past alliances give way to new alignments, emphasising that the new year has been particularly encouraging for India, sources said.

title: US Navy shoots down ‚Äòaggressively approaching‚Äô Iranian drone in Arabian Sea
content: The shootdown came within hours of another confrontation in the region, during which Iranian forces harassed a US-flagged and US-crewed merchant vessel transiting the Strait of Hormuz, according to the US military. US Central Command said the Shahed-139 drone was downed by an F-35C fighter jet operating from the Abraham Lincoln, which was sailing roughly 500 miles (800 kilometres) from Iran‚Äôs southern coast at the time. The statement added that no American personnel were injured and no equipment was damaged.

title: Walmart hits $1T market cap as CEO says he is willing to change everything except ...
content: Walmart has achieved a monumental $1 trillion market cap, becoming the first retailer to join an elite tech-dominated club. This surge, fueled by early AI adoption and a digital transformation, allows them to attract diverse shoppers.  Their recent Google partnership further solidifies their position as an emerging 'AI giant' in commerce.

title: Operation Kiya: Security forces establish contact with terrorists in J&K's Udhampur, firefight on
content: Security forces have established contact with terrorists in the Basantgarh area of Udhampur district, leading to an ongoing joint operation. The encounter began Tuesday afternoon following specific intelligence inputs, with a firefight erupting when terrorists opened fire on troops. Reinforcements have been deployed, and all exit routes sealed as the operation continues.

title: Rahul claims PM is ‚Äòunder US pressure‚Äô, ‚Äòselling away blood & sweat‚Äô of farmers
content: Rahul Gandhi said the case against Adani basically targets the PM because the business leader represents the financial structure of Modi and BJP, while the US has not yet released the full material they have on Epstein Files. ‚ÄúThese are the two pressure points, and the country should understand that the PM is compromised,‚Äù he told reporters.

title: ‚ÄòA reset and fresh start‚Äô: India‚ÄìChina bilateral trade hits record $155 billion
content: Bilateral trade between India and China reached a record $155 billion in 2025, marking over 12% year-on-year growth. Chinese Ambassador Xu Feihong highlighted this achievement, alongside support for India's BRICS presidency and a commitment to advancing the Global South's development agenda.

title: Amazon layoffs: What WARN filing in Amazon's 'home state' says on roles cut and more
content: Amazon is laying off 2,198 employees in Washington, primarily impacting software development, engineering management, and product roles. These cuts are part of a broader company-wide reduction affecting 16,000 corporate employees globally. The separations, scheduled to begin April 28, 2026, aim to "reduce layers, increase ownership, and remove bureaucracy."

title: Adani arm ties up with Italian firm to build copters in India
content: The MoU was signed in the presence of defence secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh and A Anbarasu, DG (acquisition) in the department of defence (MoD), who called the collaboration a ‚Äústrategic marriage‚Äù. It comes just a week after the Adani company and Brazilian aerospace major Embraer announced a strategic collaboration for setting up a fixed-wing aircraft manufacturing facility in India.

title: World Cancer Day: The tests you keep postponing could actually save your life
content: World Cancer Day highlights a global surge in cancer cases, with India experiencing a significant increase. The 2026 theme, 'United by Unique,' emphasizes personalized care. Early detection through screening, though underutilized, is crucial, alongside lifestyle changes for prevention. Experts stress the importance of regular check-ups and addressing common warning signs.

title: Willow by Cricbuzz to stream Team USA T20 World Cup 2026 matches free on YouTube
content: Willow by Cricbuzz has announced major updates for the 2026 season, including free streaming of all four Team USA matches at the ICC Men‚Äôs T20 World Cup on YouTube for the first time. The platform has also partnered with Jomboy Media for creator-led alternate telecasts and unveiled a revamped, faster viewing experience across its apps and devices.

title: 26-year-old fintech startup founder charged with US visa fraud and lying
content: A Turkish tech executive has been indicted for defrauding venture capitalists of $7 million in seed money. Gokce Guven allegedly used false financial statements and fabricated documents to secure investments for her fintech company, Kalder Inc. The proceeds were then used to obtain an O-1A "extraordinary ability" visa through similar misrepresentations.

title: 'Border 2': Sunny Deol starrer crosses Rs 286 crore despite declining numbers
content: 'Border 2' has made waves at the box office, raking in an impressive Rs 286.75 crore domestically and a staggering Rs 392.5 crore internationally. This gripping war drama, following in the footsteps of its 1997 predecessor, has experienced a slight downturn in attendance on its eleventh day but continues to captivate audiences.

title: Govt collects health cess, but spends less than it did earlier
content: When the health cess was introduced, the understanding was that it would boost health expenditure by topping up what the govt was already allocating. Clearly, that has not happened. Instead, cess is masking what would otherwise be a steep cut in the share of health in total Budget and in GDP. From 0.32% of the GDP in 2019, the year before Covid struck, the share has fallen to 0.27% even with the cess component.

title: Jaishankar meets Rubio in Washington ahead of critical minerals ministerial meet
content: The United States is set to host the inaugural critical minerals ministerial on Wednesday (local time) in Washington DC, bringing together delegations from more than 50 countries to deepen cooperation on securing and diversifying global critical mineral supply chains, according to a notice issued earlier by the US State Department‚Äôs Office of the Spokesperson.

title: India, US press ahead with deal but challenges remain
content: The first is the India-Pakistan re-hyphenation Trump has brought upon India through his courting of Rawalpindi. It is here US ambassador to India Sergio Gor, who seems to have found a way out of the trade impasse within weeks of arrival, may have an important role to play. Suspense still looms over his dual role as Trump‚Äôs special envoy for south Asia and any false move bracketing India with Pakistan, let alone playing sheriff, will be met with resistance.

title: Grounded 787‚Äôs fuel control switch lock satisfactory: Govt
content: The first grounding occurred on Feb 1 after a malfunction was registered by the crew of B787 (VT-ANX) during engine start to operate flight AI-132 from London to Bengaluru. The incident was critical as the fuel control switch locking mechanism has been at the centre of the investigation into the June 12 Air India Ahmedabad crash.

title: India-US trade deal unlikely to prompt near-term decline in Russian crude imports
content: While govt is yet to comment on US President Donald Trump's claim that India will stop Russian crude purchases, officials pointed out that supplies had come down from Nov due to the sanctions on the two entities. Experts said imports are expected to remain broadly stable through first and second quarters of 2026-27, with the recent moderation likely to be offset by higher inflows from West Asia.

title: 8 opposition MPs suspended after chaos in Lok Sabha over ex-Army chief‚Äôs book
content: In a protest letter to Speaker Om Birla, Rahul said it was the first time the LOP was not allowed to speak on the President‚Äôs joint address, and it is a blot on democracy. The suspensions and bedlam have put a question mark on proceedings for Wednesday, when PM Narendra Modi is scheduled to reply to the motion of thanks on the President‚Äôs address.

title: Brian & Sarah Vickers net worth: NASCAR earnings, real estate
content: Former NASCAR driver Brian Vickers and his wife Sarah Vickers amassed a fortune. Their wealth stemmed from racing wins, sponsor deals, and substantial property investments. Their combined net worth reached over $20 million. Vickers' career included three Cup Series victories and a notable comeback from health issues. The couple's real estate holdings, including a Miami home valued at $6.

title: ‚ÄòPunitive demolitions‚Äô continue in UP despite SC ruling, says HC
content: A division bench comprising Justices Atul Sreedharan and Siddharth Nandan said the court has come across multiple cases in which a demolition notice was issued to the occupants immediately after they committed an offence, and after the ostensible fulfilment of statutory requirement, the dwelling places were demolished. The court made the observations on Jan 21 while hearing a writ petition.

title: Should cops just face bullets and not fire back, asks UP CM Yogi Adityanath
content: Speaking at a pharma conclave in the city on Tuesday, he said restoring public confidence was as big a challenge as tackling crime after 2017. Yogi said he had seen how criminals mocked the law and made the people of the state suffer between 2003 and 2017, adding that law and order was his biggest challenge when PM Narendra Modi delegated the responsibility of UP to him in 2017.

title: Foreign funds likely to drive into India again
content: So far in 2026, foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have net sold stocks worth nearly Rs 35,000 crore in the Indian market. This comes on top of the Rs 1.7 lakh crore worth of stocks net offloaded in 2025. The sell-off, in turn, put pressure on the rupee. Despite strong central govt intervention, the rupee had depreciated over 6% since the start of 2025.

title: Peacocks at 6,000ft spark concerns over climate change impact
content: Peacocks in Himachal Pradesh are generally found at altitudes of 1,000m but some thrive in areas up to 1,500m. Himachal Pradesh has become significantly warmer in the last 124 years. According to meteorological department, the state has recorded a rise of 1.5 degrees Celsius in average mean temperature since 1901.

title: All safeguards followed in Wangchuk case: Govt to Supreme Court
content: Referring to the activist‚Äôs speech, the solicitor general said he had stated that Ladakhis could not choose their own representatives while China and Tibet etc have autonomous rights which is highly objectionable. ‚ÄúThis is a preventive action so that he doesn‚Äôt keep repeating the things he (Wangchuk) said. The detention strikes at the very purpose for which the NSA was enacted. It will have a contextual meaning. Every state has region specific sensitivities,‚Äù Mehta said.

title: Sustained PM2.5 exposure ups depression risk: Study
content: The burden was highest among urban metro residents, people aged 40-49 years, and those from lower-income groups. Regionally, pollution-linked depression showed stronger associations in eastern India, while anxiety was more prominent in the western region. Risks also peaked during the post-monsoon season, when pollution levels typically rise. he study went beyond overall PM2.5 levels to examine individual chemical constituents of air pollution.

title: Duty relief kicks in, now you can shop a bit more while abroad
content: Used personal effects like clothes and travel souvenirs are duty-free. New goods like gifts purchases abroad qualify according to new limits. Goods above the duty-free limit are dutiable under normal customs provisions unless specifically exempted by the law. These allowances apply only to goods carried on the passenger‚Äôs person or in bona fide baggage.

title: Taekwondo master to be Manipur CM, may get 2 deputies
content: Keen to project a message of ethnic reconciliation in the north-eastern state, which was rocked by Meitei versus Kuki violence, BJP is considering appointing two deputy CMs ‚Äî one each from the Kuki and Naga communities, with Singh being a Meitei. Nemcha Kipgen, a Kuki figure and former minister, is likely to be one of the deputy CMs.

title: Judges reserving verdicts for years ‚Äòan ailment‚Äô: Supreme Court
content: A litigant who approaches the court must get to know what judgment is given on his plea,‚Äù the CJI said. The same HC judge, Justice Rongon Mukhopadhyay, was found to have kept several judgments pending for years, even in cases where the convicts had appealed against their capital and life sentences. The judge had delivered the verdicts in those cases only after SC took judicial notice of the same.

title: Woman not entitled to maintenance if living apart sans valid reason: HC
content: A bench headed by Chief Justice Ramesh Sinha held that the family court‚Äôs order showed no illegality or defect warranting interference by the HC. The HC noted that when the husband had filed a petition seeking restitution of conjugal rights, the woman could have returned to her matrimonial home to resume marital life.

title: Wipro‚Äôs stand on dispute over ex gratia with ex-staffer abuse of law, says HC, imposes costs
content: ‚Äã‚ÄãIn recognition of his contribution, he was offered an ex gratia lump sum amount of Rs 6,32,000, payable after 18 months from the date of cessation of employment, subject to the condition that from the date of cessation he would not join competing companies, namely Philips India Limited or Bajaj Electricals Ltd.

title: Wooing voters on caste, religion lines no ground to bar party: HC
content: A division bench of Justice Rajan Roy and Justice AK Chaudhary passed the verdict on a PIL filed by Motilal Yadav in 2013, seeking direction against holding of caste-based rallies by political parties. In an interim order in July 2013 itself, a bench of Justice Uma Nath Singh and Justice Mahendra Dayal had stayed caste-based rallies ‚Äúwith immediate effect‚Äù throughout UP.

title: Tariff-ic reset? US‚ÄìIndia pact announced ‚Äî what's clear, what's not
content: India and the US have struck a landmark trade deal, significantly reducing US tariffs on Indian goods to 18%. This agreement aims to boost economic cooperation, with India committing to increased US imports, including energy. Sensitive sectors like agriculture and dairy remain protected, marking a positive development for bilateral ties.

title: Why Trump administration is still imposing 18% tariff on India - Explained
content: The US will reduce tariffs on most Indian goods to 18% from 50% as part of a new trade agreement, aiming to address the large trade deficit. India has agreed to cut tariffs on a range of US products, including industrial goods, wine, and spirits, to zero. Sensitive Indian agriculture and dairy sectors remain protected under the deal.

title: 2 Injured, Over 70 Rescued After Fire In Thane's Residential Building
content: Two persons were injured and more than 70 trapped people rescued after a fire broke out in an electric duct of an 18-storey residential building in Maharashtra's Thane city early on Tuesday, an official said.

title: "Physically Handicapped": Pakistan's Khawaja Asif's Big Admission On Balochistan Attacks
content: Khawaja Asif, the Defence Minister of Pakistan, has admitted that the Pakistani security forces were "handicapped" against Baloch rebels due to the sheer size of Balochistan province as they battle a fresh surge in militant violence.

title: NATO Has Started Military Planning For An Arctic Mission
content: NATO has started military planning for an Arctic Sentry mission, a spokesperson for the alliance's military headquarters SHAPE said on Tuesday, against a backdrop of tensions between the US and European allies over Greenland.

title: Thousands Of Venezuelans March To Demand Maduro's Release
content: Thousands of backers of Venezuela's former leader Nicolas Maduro, who was ousted in a deadly US military operation, marched in Caracas on Tuesday to demand his freedom.

title: Nukes To Minerals: What Jaishankar, Rubio Discussed After India-US Deal
content: Foreign Minister S Jaishankar, who is in Washington, met US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and discussed formalising bilateral cooperation on critical minerals exploration, mining, and processing.

title: Trump Urges Putin "To End War" After Russia Resumes Ukraine Strikes
content: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday urged Russian President Vladimir Putin to end the nearly four-year Ukraine war, after Moscow resumed its attacks on Kyiv following a week-long cold-weather halt.

title: Trump Signs Spending Bill Ending US Government Shutdown
content: President Donald Trump signed a spending bill on Tuesday ending the four-day partial government shutdown sparked by Democratic opposition to funding for the federal agency carrying out his sweeping immigration crackdown.

title: 2 Nigerians Arrested For Cheating Employees In Gurugram: Cops
content: Two Nigerian nationals have been arrested for allegedly extorting around Rs 10 lakh from employees of a company by posing as its directors, police said on Tuesday.

title: Ex-Libyan Leader Muammar Gaddafi's Son Killed By Armed Gang
content: The most prominent son of late Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi, Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, has been killed, sources close to the family, his lawyer Khaled el-Zaydi and Libyan media said on Tuesday.

title: S Jaishankar Meets Scott Bessent, Discusses Strengthening India-US Economic Ties
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday met US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent in Washington DC as part of an ongoing three-day visit to the United States.

title: S Jaishankar Meets US Secretary Of State Marco Rubio In Washington
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met US Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Washington on Tuesday ahead of an inaugural ministerial on critical minerals.

title: ChatGPT Down For Thousands Of Users In US: Report
content: ChatGPT was down for thousands of users in the US on Tuesday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.

title: Former US First Lady Jill Biden's Ex-Husband Charged With Killing Wife
content: The first husband of former first lady Jill Biden has been charged with killing his wife at their Delaware home in late December, authorities announced in a news release Tuesday.

title: 2019 Email Shows Noam Chomsky Advised Epstein To Avoid Media "Vultures"
content: Renowned American intellectual Noam Chomsky privately sympathized with Jeffrey Epstein over what he described as the "horrible way" the press treated the late sex offender, urging him in a 2019 email to lie low and avoid media "vultures."

title: Businessmen, Car Owners Among Ration Card Beneficiaries In Delhi: MLA
content: A verification drive into Delhi's ration card system has thrown up startling gaps - from cards issued in the names of the dead to beneficiaries earning well above eligibility limits, with over two lakh ration cards flagged as irregular.

title: Spain Seeks Social Media Ban For Children Below 16
content: Spain will seek to ban social media for under-16s to protect them from harmful content such as pornography and violence, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Tuesday, in the latest such move by governments.

title: From India To Canada's Far North: New Archbishop Serves Indigenous Catholics
content: As a teenager in southern India, Susai Jesu led 4:30 a.m. prayer services in his small Catholic village before the farmers went into the fields. He directed the choir, helped at Mass and soon began training for the priesthood.

title: Fact Check: Viral Images Of Zohran Mamdani With Epstein Are AI-Generated
content: Multiple AI-generated photos falsely claiming to show New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani as a child and his mother, filmmaker Mira Nair, with disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.

title: US Tanker Approached By Iranian Gunboats In Strait Of Hormuz
content: British maritime security firm Vanguard Tech said Tuesday that a US-flagged tanker was approached and challenged by Iranian gunboats in the Strait of Hormuz before continuing on its way.

title: France Ditches Zoom, Teams as Europe Seeks Digital Autonomy From US
content: In France, civil servants will ditch Zoom and Teams for a homegrown video conference system. Soldiers in Austria are using open source office software to write reports after the military dropped Microsoft Office.

title: Wings of two aircraft collide at Mumbai airport; both had flyers on board
content: Mumbai Airport witnessed a startling incident Tuesday as the wingtips of a stationary Air India Airbus and a taxiing IndiGo A320 scraped each other. The Air India flight to Coimbatore was delayed due to the contact, which damaged its wingtip.

title: J&K: Sajad Lone pushes for Article 370 in LG‚Äôs speech, Speaker rejects
content: The Speaker further pointed out that granting statehood falls within the domain of the Centre and advised Lone to raise only those issues on which J&K govt is competent to respond or take a decision. Outside the assembly, Lone said four of his other amendments were, however, accepted, including those concerning daily wagers, NLU and condemnation of attacks on Kashmiris outside J&K.

title: UK-India FTA omits several key UK interests: House of Lords report
content: The UK govt did not conclude a bilateral investment treaty, or arrangements in relation to legal services, new market access for financial services, or final arrangements for mutual recognition of professional qualifications, and India did not get ‚Äúas much on the mobility issues as it would have liked‚Äù, the report says.

title: Operation Kiya: Encounter erupts in J&K‚Äôs Udhampur
content: Officials said at least two to three Pakistani terrorists were believed to be trapped within the cordon. The White Knight Corps post stated that a joint team of Counter Insurgency Force Delta, police, and CRPF established contact with the terrorists around 4pm. Earlier, security forces had launched a search operation in Jopher area in Udhampur‚Äôs Ramnagar late Sunday.

title: Train to Pahalgam put on hold for now as J&K govt, MPs flag threat to apple orchards
content: The governing National Conference said the halted proposals include the Bijbehara-Pahalgam railway link and the Pulwama-Shopian railway project. The issue was earlier raised by local farmers, legislators, including Anantnag-Poonch MP Mian Altaf and the opposition PDP leaders. Vaishnaw said there was a demand for three additional railway projects in the region, but these had been kept on hold for now due to the objections raised.

title: Take fresh call on CCI probe against Flipkart: SC to NCLAT
content:
File photo

NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Tuesday asked the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) to decide afresh whether it is necessary for the Competition Commission of India (CCI) to probe a 2018 complaint accusing e-commerce major Flipkart of abuse of its market dominant position. Taking up an appeal by Flipkart against a March 4, 2020, NCLAT order, a three-judge bench headed by CJI Surya Kant said it would be proper if the tribunal decided afresh whether a probe was necessary to be conducted in a 2018 complaint, which accused the e-commerce platform of resorting to predatory pricing. Fair-trade regulator CCI had rejected the complaint by All India Online Vendors Association. However, on appeal, NCLAT had asked CCI to conduct a probe on the complaint. In Dec 2020, SC had stayed the NCLAT order.

End of Article

title: Fine can‚Äôt exceed twice the value of bounced cheque: Karnataka HC
content: the high court ruled that trial courts cannot levy fines exceeding twice the dishonoured cheque amount . the judge directed Mahadevi to pay Rs 7.6 lakh as compensation to the seller and Rs 5,000 as defraying expenses to state govt .

title: Delhi court summons 3 Congress netas in defamation case
content:
Jairam Ramesh

NEW DELHI: A Delhi court on Tuesday summoned Congress‚Äôs Jairam Ramesh, Pawan Khera and Ragini Nayak in a criminal defamation case filed by India TV chairman and editor-in-chief Rajat Sharma. Magistrate Devanshi Janmeja of Saket court noted there were ‚Äúsufficient grounds‚Äù to summon the three on July 27. The summons direct the three to respond to charges under IPC sections 465 (forgery), 471 (using forged document or electronic record), and 499 and 500 (criminal defamation). The complaint stems from allegations by Nayak in June 2024 that Sharma used ‚Äúderogatory language‚Äù against her during a live TV debate. Sharma said the accusations were based on a tampered video containing captions not part of the original broadcast. Sharma said the video was circulated on X by Nayak and amplified by Khera and Ramesh, causing ‚Äúreputational harm‚Äù.

End of Article

title: MMA divisional rankings: Benoit Saint Denis, Mauricio Ruffy rise at lightweight
content: Saturday's UFC 325 was headlined by a meeting between the No. 1-ranked featherweight, champion  Alexander Volkanovski , and No. 2  Diego Lopes , a fight won by the champ. But it was one weight class heavier where the fight card impacted the ESPN divisional MMA rankings. Lightweight  Beno√Æt Saint Denis  knocked out  Dan Hooker  in the co-main event to move up three spots to No. 7. And in the fight right before that,  Mauricio Ruffy  scored a knockout of  Rafael Fiziev  to earn a place in the top 10. Those were the only changes in the rankings. Here are the  ESPN pound-for-pound MMA rankings  and a  list of current UFC champions  in all weight classes. Results are current; rankings as of Feb. 3. To be eligible for the rankings, a fighter must have competed over the past 12 months or must have an upcoming fight booked. Fighters who have been dropped for inactivity can be reinstated only after they compete.

title: Projecting Rounds 1-2 of the draft: Landing spots for 11 Senior Bowl standouts

title: State of MLB: Has the Dodgers' dominance propelled the NL past the AL?
content: the national league was founded in 1876 by the Chicago White Stockings officer . it was a loose affiliation of clubs that had problems with competitive balance . in 1901, the American League declared itself a competitor to the NL, jumping up from its minor league status .

title: An epic Rookie of the Year race? This October's Trey Yesavage? 2026 predictions for MLB's top prospects
content: Kiley McDaniel has ranked the best prospects and farm systems in baseball ahead of the 2026 MLB season . the list includes Caden Scarborough, who will be a fixture in the Tigers' every-day lineup by the end of the season.
